column4: you 'can' sure, you 'can' jump off a cliff too, if you wish, being able to do something and it being practical are not really mutually inclusive, soooo, I'd suggest instead to do a full-install wheneve possible
I'm just saying hehe, updater beware
try this instead" yes Janelle you can, but it's not recommended" see same thing, but much less rude

yes you can, but often times the update doesn't go as smooth as one wishes, and thus is better to back yourself up before doing so, for backups, is better to have them and no need them  than need them and not have them, sooo, is recommended  instead to do full-install and your chances of success are greater :)
